text: Hey Head Squeezers, I hope you're well.

I've got something very special for you this
month, which I hope you like.

I was chatting to a mate of mine, called Mike,
and we were trying to think of a way to celebrate
the festive season in style.
And basically in style means -- with EXPLOSIONS!
YEAH!

What we came up with just grew and grew and
it got so big I thought we should take it

to the Head Squeeze grotto and the Head Science
Santa there really liked it so it is on the
channel!

We ran on down to the workshop, called up
a few elves and we were building flame throwers,

rigging up fireworks and we even got some
water pistols and filled them with concentrated
sulphuric acid.

That's one of my favourites -- make sure you
stay tuned for that!

The result is here, in this playlist, it's
called the '12 Explosions of Christmas'. 12

bangs, booms and blasts, each one with a merry
little twist.

Plus, we have a very special helper -- the
science demo King that is Mr Steve Spangler.

He's an absolute legend and it really is an
honour for him to join us on this.

Go check out the Spangler Effect channel,
that's Steve's channel, and he has done his

own little twist, his own take, his own festive
cheer with one of his favourite experiments.

We will put the link to that in this playlist
as well.

So it's almost time to kick off our Christmas
pyro extravaganza, but I know that you Head

Squeezers are a curious bunch so I've done
an explanation video for each one of the twelve
explosions.

We're gonna release them everyday all the
way up to Christmas Eve.

If you've already subscribed to the channel,
thank you so so much, it means a lot to us.

If you haven't, but you're really interested
in all these behind the scenes, making of,

science of videos then just click subscribe,
and they'll be delivered straight into your
YouTube timeline.
Easy as that!

I think we should get going, until next time,
Merry Head Squeezing!
